hints.raw_directive:
2108: The coupling is **asymmetric**: $P(M | S_1)$ depends only on $S_1$, not $S_2$.
2109: 
2110: :::{prf:proposition} Full Expectation Over Matching
2111: :label: prop-full-expectation-matching
2112: 
2113: Taking expectation over the matching distribution:
2114: 
2115: $$
2116: \mathbb{E}_{M \sim P(\cdot | S_1)}[\mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'}) \mid M]] \leq \gamma_{\text{pair}} W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2}) + C_{\text{pair}}

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-21
hints.content:
2119: 
2120: :::{prf:proof}
2121: By the tower property of expectation:
2122: 
2123: $$
2124: \mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'})] = \mathbb{E}_M[\mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'}) \mid M]]
2125: $$
2126: 
2127: Using Proposition {prf:ref}`prop-matching-conditional-contraction`:
2128: 
2129: $$
2130: \mathbb{E}_M[\mathbb{E}[W_2^2 \mid M]] \leq \mathbb{E}_M[\gamma_{\text{pair}} W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2}) + C_{\text{pair}}]
2131: $$
2132: 
2133: Since $W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2})$ is deterministic given $S_1$ and $S_2$ (not random in $M$):
2134: 
2135: $$
hints.raw_directive:
2118: :::
2119: 
2120: :::{prf:proof}
2121: By the tower property of expectation:
2122: 
2123: $$
2124: \mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'})] = \mathbb{E}_M[\mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'}) \mid M]]
2125: $$
2126: 
2127: Using Proposition {prf:ref}`prop-matching-conditional-contraction`:
2128: 
2129: $$
2130: \mathbb{E}_M[\mathbb{E}[W_2^2 \mid M]] \leq \mathbb{E}_M[\gamma_{\text{pair}} W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2}) + C_{\text{pair}}]
2131: $$
2132: 
2133: Since $W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2})$ is deterministic given $S_1$ and $S_2$ (not random in $M$):
2134: 
2135: $$
2136: = \gamma_{\text{pair}} W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2}) + C_{\text{pair}} \qquad \Box

hints.label: def-w2-contraction-constants
hints.title: Wasserstein Contraction Constants
hints.content:
2143: :label: def-w2-contraction-constants
2144: 
2145: The Wasserstein-2 contraction for the cloning operator is characterized by:
2146: 
2147: $$
2148: \kappa_W := 1 - \gamma_{\text{pair}} = \frac{p_u \eta}{2} > 0
2149: $$
2150: 
2151: where:
2152: - $p_u > 0$ is the uniform lower bound on cloning probability for unfit walkers (Lemma 8.3.2 in [03_cloning.md](03_cloning.md))
2153: - $\eta > 0$ is the Outlier Alignment constant (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-outlier-alignment`)
2154: 
2155: The additive constant is:
2156: 
2157: $$
2158: C_W := C_{\text{pair}} = 4d\delta^2
2159: $$
hints.raw_directive:
2140: ### 7.2. Final Constants
2141: 
2142: :::{prf:definition} Wasserstein Contraction Constants
2143: :label: def-w2-contraction-constants
2144: 
2145: The Wasserstein-2 contraction for the cloning operator is characterized by:
2146: 
2147: $$
2148: \kappa_W := 1 - \gamma_{\text{pair}} = \frac{p_u \eta}{2} > 0
2149: $$
2150: 
2151: where:
2152: - $p_u > 0$ is the uniform lower bound on cloning probability for unfit walkers (Lemma 8.3.2 in [03_cloning.md](03_cloning.md))
2153: - $\eta > 0$ is the Outlier Alignment constant (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-outlier-alignment`)
2154: 
2155: The additive constant is:
2156: 
2157: $$
2158: C_W := C_{\text{pair}} = 4d\delta^2
2159: $$
2160:
